program.name: NextGen

program.description: The NextGen Solutions Vendors Guide catalogues U.S. providers of the technology and services necessary to implement the Next Generation Air Transportation System (NextGen) in accordance with the International Civil Aviation Organization?s (ICAO) Aviation System Block Upgrade (ASBU) initiative. These state-of-the-art solutions address current and expected needs regarding air traffic management, airspace capacity, flight path efficiency, enhanced communications and data exchanges, and operational improvements to the airport environment.

pageLabels.noResultsForCriteriaLabel: There are no results for the selected criteria

filterItems.summary: Optimum Capacity and Flexible Flights refer to the target performance benefit of fully realized complexity management through global collaborative ATM. The capabilities inherent in this performance improvement area include free-routing, network operations, initial surveillance, self separation, optimum flight levels, airborne collision avoidance systems, and safety nets.
filterItems.name: Optimum Capacity and Flexible Flights

filterItems.summary: Globally Interoperable Systems and Data refers to the target performance benefit of fully realized flight and flow information for the collaborative environment (FF-ICE) and enhanced information management. The capabilities inherent in this performance improvement area include FF-ICE, digital aeronautical information management, system-wide information management (SWIM), and advanced meteorological information.
filterItems.name: Globally Interoperable Systems and Data

filterItems.summary: Airport Operations refers to the target performance benefit of fully realized arrival, departure, and surface management (AMAN/DMAN/SMAN). The capabilities inherent in this performance improvement area include airport accessibility, preliminary arrival and departure management, collaborative decision-making in the airport environment, surface operations, wake turbulence separation, and remote aerodrome control towers.
filterItems.name: Airport Operations

filterItems.summary: Efficient Flight Path refers to the target performance benefit of fully realized Trajectory-Based Operations (TBO). The capabilities inherent in this performance improvement area include continuous descent operations, fully synchronized trajectory-based operations, continuous climb operations, and remotely piloted aircraft.
filterItems.name: Efficient Flight Path

filterItems.summary: Knowledge and Service Providers refers to the vendors who can provide the expertise necessary to implement the four ICAO-designated performance improvement areas (i.e., Airport Operations, Globally Interoperable Systems and Data, Optimum Capacity and Flexible Flights, and Efficient Flight Path) as well as the services that complement and/or support such implementation.
filterItems.name: Knowledge and Service Providers
Enhanced Flow Performance through Network Operational Planning
Enhanced Operational Decisions through Integrated Meteorological Information (Near-term and Immediate Service)
Enhanced Operational Decisions through Integrated Meteorological Information (Planning and Near-term Service)
Improve Traffic flow through Runway Sequencing (AMAN/DMAN)
Improved Flexibility And Efficiency In Descent Profiles (CDOS) Using VNAV, Required Speed, And Time At Arrival
Increased Effectiveness of Ground-Based Safety Nets
Initial Integration of Remotely Piloted Aircraft (RPA) into Non-Segregated Airspace
Optimization of Approach Procedures Including Vertical Guidance
Optimized Surface Routing and Safety Benefits (A-SMGCS Level 3-4 and SVS)
Safety and Efficiency of Surface Operations (A-SMGCS Level 1-2)
